http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20070123/ap_on_re_us/flight_tantrum_1
 
 "AirTran officials say they were only following Federal Aviation Administration rules that children age 2 and above must have their own seat and be wearing a seatbelt upon takeoff.
 
 "The flight was already delayed 15 minutes and in fairness to the other 112 passengers on the plane, the crew made an operational decision to remove the family," Graham-Weaver said.
 
 But Julie Kulesza said: "We weren't giving an opportunity to hold her, console her or anything."
 
 "Elly was sitting in front of our seat crying," she said in a phone interview. "The attendant motioned to a seat and asked if we purchased it for her."
 
 They had paid for the seat. Gerry Kulesza said another attendant then approached the family and told him: "You need to get her in control and in her seat."
 
 The couple told the attendants they were trying. Julie Kulesza said she asked the attendants if Elly could sit on her lap, but they said no.
 
 The family flew home the next day.
 
 The Orlando-based carrier reimbursed the family $595.80, the cost of the three tickets, and offered them three roundtrip tickets anywhere the airline flies, Graham-Weaver said.
 
 But that's too little, too late for the Kuleszas. The father said they would never fly AirTran again."
 
 ---
 
 And I am now a lifetime Airtran Customer.
 
 Any thoughts, pro or con?

post_info.post_title: Girl Kicked Off Plane After Tantrum

The Orlando-based carrier reimbursed the family $595.80, the cost of the three tickets, and offered them three roundtrip tickets anywhere the airline flies, Graham-Weaver said.
 
 But that's too little, too late for the Kuleszas. The father said they would never fly AirTran again."
 

 
 OMG! What fools! They got twice their money back! :xbanghead

The crew did what they had to do. It's that simple. I have kids too, and if mine were out of control to the point where the plane couldn't take off, then I'd completely understand the airline saying you have to get off. It's not the airline's (or the other passengers) problem that the parent wouldn't put the kid in the seat and lock 'em in.

I've been delayed while sitting on the plane before. There's nothing more frustrating. This person fell on some escalators while at the Keflavik Airport in Reykjavik, Iceland, and it took them a whole hour to realize they might have damaged their head! So, we sat on the plane for another two hours as the ambulance drove over.

The crew did what they had to do. It's that simple. I have kids too, and if mine were out of control to the point where the plane couldn't take off, then I'd completely understand the airline saying you have to get off. It's not the airline's (or the other passengers) problem that the parent wouldn't put the kid in the seat and lock 'em in.

 
 I totally agree. The world should not have to wait for your obnoxious kid. I would not make them wait for mine.

I also believe the airline acted appropriately. I only wish there were flight attendants everywhere that would remove any family unable to control their child(ren). When kids are running up and down the aisle at the grocery store and the mom or dad is just sitting there looking at canned goods trying to pick out a tasty, affordable stringbean and completely ignoring their child's unacceptable behavior, I get irritated. I understand that sometimes ignoring a child's attention-grabbing antics can be an effective parenting method. However, save that for the privacy of your home. When you are in public, there are other people to consider.
 
 On a side note, I know a girl who was in the grocery store with a similar situation. It was a dad and his son, and the little boy was running up and down the aisle. The dad seemed to be oblivious. His behavior was such that if you told him he even had a son, he might regard you with surprise. When my friend came into the same aisle, it only took a few seconds for her to become annoyed at the father's lack of discipline. Then the kid ran into her. After that, she waited for him to make another pass, then she stuck her leg out and tripped the little booger. Haha! Wouldn't we all love to do that?
 
 The moral here is that parents need to learn to control their kids. Bad kids are usually the result of the parents, just as good kids are usually the result of the parents. This is a lesson that parents need to understand. It could also be applied to our public education system, but that is another thread.

The title should have read "Infant Kicked Off Plane."
 
 I consider kids under three to be infants.
 
 Also, some kids have severe ear pain in flight because of pressure differential and shouldn't fly.
 
 Or, kids, being the classic conservatives that they are, often take severe offense at changes in their environment, especially if they find themselves in strange surroundings.

Kids are baby goats. 
 
 Parents who cannot control their children should not be allowed on airplanes with them.
 
 Instead of offering the parents free goodies and an apology, I would be sending them a bill for the flight delay.

 Well thats a bit much. There is only so much one individual can control another (even a child) without getting terroristic. However, Jr or little Miss do not get to hold up everyone's flight either - off the plane with them.

 I guess I'm gonna be the odd man out here simply because this child wasn't running up and down the aisle nor was he jumping on people or screaming just to be an out of control brat. This child was upset, he was crying and most likely would have calmed right down had his mom been able to hold him and comfort him. For a child to get upset in foriegn surroundings like a cramped plane with strange odors and people isn't a federal crime, nor is it to be unexpected. I believe the Airline offered the family what they did as compensation out of a sense of guilt and responsibility because they knew their employees acted irrationally and irresponsibly because that 3 year old didn't act abnormal at all compared to every other 3 year old alive, either today or 50 years ago. What is wrong with us when we have no patience with children who are acting perfectly normal for their age ? emoticon_confused

 I agree with the phrase,"Baby goats". Because goats are hard-headed they don't listen, like kids. And even though I LOVE children. I too would kick them, and their parents off a plane and send them the bill for the delay. Time is money people!
